* New York Yankees #9 retired }} 'Roger Eugene Maris' (September 10, 1934 â
  December 14, 1985) was an American professional baseball player. He was a
  Major League Baseball right fielder for 12 seasons and on four teams, from
  1957 through 1968. Maris hit a Major League record 61 home runs during the
  1961 season for the New York Yankees, breaking Babe Ruth's single-season
  record of 60 home runs in 1927. Maris' record stood for the next 37 years.

Maris was an American League Most Valuable Player (1960â1961), All-Star (1959-
1962), and Gold Glove winner (1960). Baseball-Reference.Com: Roger Maris [http://www.baseball-
reference.com/players/m/marisro01.shtml#batting_standard::none] He appeared
in seven World Series, five as a member of the Yankees and two with the St.
Louis Cardinals. His accomplishment of 61 home runs in a season came back to the
forefront in 1998, when the home run record was broken by two players from the
National League, Mark McGwire (70) and Sammy Sosa (66).
